:: 2 ::
You are mine. Out of the affection and love I have for you,
I intend to give you some immovable property free of charge, considering it as a reward for my love.
I have my ancestral property, namely, my ancestral family, which is yellow saffron, as a gift from my birth family.
I I hereby grant you the free transfer of the immovable property listed in the Schedule below, including all the rights and obligations of the land, water, treasury, common water ways, common roads, easement rights, etc., which have been in my complete possession and possession up to this day, together with all the rights and obligations of the land, water, treasury, common water ways, common roads, easement rights, etc., to you by writing this settlement deed and taking possession of the said property listed in the Schedule today itself. Therefore, from now on, you are the full rightful owner of the said property and you shall pay all the taxes payable to the Government and shall enjoy it freely, freely, and with full rights of donation, sale, and enjoyment, as you wish, through your sons and grandsons.
In this regard, what are my knowledge, when and by whom? Despite the obstacles, I, my heirs, will settle all of them at our own expense and implement the schedule property in this manner without interruption.
This settlement deed is written in your name, making you believe and believe that this property is an undisputed property that has not been encumbered by any other person in the past, such as mortgages, purchases, purchase agreements, leases, guarantees, etc.
This property has no other heirs, male or female, or rightful owners except me. This property has not been assigned under Government Act No. 9/77. Accordingly, the agreements have been filed for the registration of this property in your name.

3. The encumbrances shown in the eEC are those discovered with reference to the description of properties furnished by the applicants at the time of Registration.
4. All efforts are made for accuracy of data. However in case of any conflict, original data shall prevail.
5. In case system responds by "Data Not Found", for confirmation approach SRO concern.
For Information Only.

encumbranceDetails.description: VILL/COL:SOMAVARAM/SOMAVARAM(0-0) W-B: 0-0 SURVEY: 67HOUSE: 1-68 EXTENT:156.22SQ.Yds BUILT: 0SQ. FTBoundires: [N]: ft 38 j jyothihouse [S] ft 38 road [E]: ft 37 ksiva house [W]: ft 37 chramnamm a house

sections.content:
The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 18356 of 2024, dated 28/Feb/2024, executed by Kadari Laxmi in her Son, favour of Kadari Lovaraju towards the property admeasuring an extent of 156.22 Sq. Yds., Located Near By House No. 1-68, comprised in survey number 67, situated in Somavaram Village & Grama Panchayati, Kirlampudi Mandal, within the District of Kakinada, registered at sub-registrar office Samalkota, is bounded as follows:

North by: Ft 38 Jatti Jyothi House
South by: Ft 38 Road
East by: Ft 37 Kaddari Siva House
West by: Ft 37 Chintapalli Ramnamma House
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
